derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English legger, ligger (denoting a large bible or breviary), probably from variants of lay and lie, influenced by Dutch legger and ligger. Current senses date from the 16th cent., except the fishing senses, known from the 17th cent

encyclopedia.content: 原义 n. 分类账 The ledgers and account books had all been destroyed. 分类账本和账簿都被销毁了。会计术语 分类账簿也称分类账。对经济业务进行分类登记，提供分类核算指标的账簿。 在会计核算中，分类账簿是必须设置的主要账簿，它所提供的核算资料是编制会计报表的主要依据。

entry.def: A ledger is a book in which a company or organization writes down the amounts of money it spends and receives.

means.word_mean: 1. a record in which commercial accounts are recorded;
